answers.answer: Hello,diabetes doesn't mean you can't get pregnant.  however, to have a healthy pregnancy you need to have your diabetes under very strict control.  9.2 fasting is way too high.  You need to get your fasting number down to < 5.0, and you other numbers should always be < 6.5.  Talk to your doctor about how much you want a baby and get a plan on how to get there.I recommend that you see a fertility doctor now for assistance and guidance.  An endocrinologist specialising in daibetic pregnancy may also be useful.  Read up on diabetes and pregnancy.  There is lots of good information.i personally can strongly recommend a low carbohydrate diet to help control blood sugars.Don't give up.  This is now time to work on this, make the changes, manage the diabetes and reach for your goals.
